intro: Uragoga lacinulata, commonly known as the laceleaf begonia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its delicate, lobed leaves that give it a lace-like appearance, and its small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant thrives in warm, humid environments and prefers well-draining soil. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and ease of care. Uragoga lacinulata is also valued for its ability to bloom throughout the growing season.
